intro: Lasiosiphon socotranus, commonly known as the Socotra morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically heart-shaped. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to the unique ecosystem of Socotra. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
